subject: RE: [junit] Testing philosophy question
msgSnippet: ... But they d be wrong symmetrically! ;-) And besides, you d have a couple of other tests to prove the actually equality of the matter. So I think that as a
messageBody:
>> How about
>
>> assertEquals(a.equals(b), b.equals(a));
>
>> which makes the test obviously about symmetry.
>
>That's really hard to think about. And they could both be wrong ...

But they'd be wrong symmetrically! ;-) And besides, you'd have a couple of other tests to prove the actually equality of the matter. So I think that as a test of symmetry, this is a neat way of writing it.

>Ron Jeffries

Simon
